page.title: 03BEATING THE BOUNDS, HELSTON
page.content: {Beating the Bounds}is celebrated in Helston each year. Ten children are chosen from each of the local schools. They are accompanied by the Mayor, Mayoress and other council officials of Helston. A sod of turf is cut and placed on each Boundary Stone, where it is beaten by the children with sprigs of May when available. Also, some people are turned upside down and their heads are banged three times on each stone. Eight Boundary Stones were beaten this year. The Boundary Stones are marked with{HB}. HB stands for Helston Boundary. The Boundary Stones are made from granite because it is a very hard local rock. We "beat" the Boundary Stones each year so that the Boundary of Helston is remembered. This used to be very important before the introduction of maps.
